description: All tables related to ASim - see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/normalization-about-schemas
icmTeam: Microsoft Azure Sentinel/Data Collection and Processing

tables.name: ASimDhcpEventLogs
tables.description: The ASIM DHCP schema represents DHCP server activity, including serving requests for DHCP IP address leased from client systems and updating a DNS server with the leases granted.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: EventProduct
columns.description: The product generating the event. The value should be one of the values listed in Vendors and Products.

columns.name: EventVendor
columns.description: The vendor of the product generating the event. The value should be one of the values listed in Vendors and Products.

columns.name: EventResult
columns.description: The outcome of the event, represented by one of the following values: Success, Partial, Failure, NA (Not Applicable).

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: The severity of the event.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: Describes the operation reported by the record.

columns.name: SrcHostname
columns.description: The device hostname, excluding domain information.

columns.name: SrcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address of the source device.

columns.name: SrcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the network interface from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: DhcpCircuitId
columns.description: The DHCP circuit ID, as defined by RFC3046.

columns.name: DhcpLeaseDuration
columns.description: The length of the lease granted to a client, in seconds.

columns.name: DhcpSessionDuration
columns.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds, for the completion of the DHCP session.

columns.name: DhcpSessionId
columns.description: The session identifier as reported by the reporting device. For the Windows DHCP server, set this to the TransactionID field.

columns.name: DhcpSrcDHCId
columns.description: The DHCP client ID, as defined by RFC4701.

columns.name: DhcpSubscriberId
columns.description: The DHCP subscriber ID, as defined by RFC3993.

columns.name: DhcpUserClass
columns.description: The DHCP User Class, as defined by RFC3004.

columns.name: DhcpUserClassId
columns.description: The DHCP User Class Id, as defined by RFC3004.

columns.name: DhcpVendorClass
columns.description: The DHCP Vendor Class, as defined by RFC3925.

columns.name: DhcpVendorClassId
columns.description: The DHCP Vendor Class Id, as defined by RFC3925.

columns.name: EventResultDetails
columns.description: Reason or details for the result reported in the EventResult field.

columns.name: DvcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema.

columns.name: DvcHostname
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema.

columns.name: DvcAction
columns.description: For reporting security systems, the action taken by the system, if applicable.

columns.name: DvcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device.

columns.name: DvcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema

columns.name: DvcDomainType
columns.description: The type of DvcDomain.

columns.name: DvcFQDN
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema.

columns.name: DvcId
columns.description: The unique ID of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema.

columns.name: DvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DvcId.

columns.name: DvcInterface
columns.description: The network interface on which data was captured. This field is typically relevant to network related activity which is captured by an intermediate or tap device.

columns.name: DvcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOriginalAction
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcOs
columns.description: The operating system running on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOsVersion
columns.description: The version of the operating system on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcScope
columns.description: The cloud platform scope the device belongs to. DvcScope map to a subscription name on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DvcScopeId
columns.description: The cloud platform scope ID the device belongs to. DvcScopeId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DvcZone
columns.description: The network on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema. The zone is defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: SrcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device.

columns.name: EventCount
columns.description: The number of events described by the record. This value is used when the source supports aggregation, and a single record might represent multiple events.

columns.name: EventMessage
columns.description: A general message or description, either included in or generated from the record.

columns.name: EventOriginalResultDetails
columns.description: The original result details provided by the source. This value is used to derive EventResultDetails, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: EventOriginalSeverity
columns.description: The original severity as provided by the reporting device. This value is used to derive EventSeverity.

columns.name: EventOriginalSubType
columns.description: The original event subtype or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalType
columns.description: The original event type or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalUid
columns.description: A unique ID of the original record, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOwner
columns.description: The owner of the event, which is usually the department or subsidiary in which it was generated.

columns.name: EventProductVersion
columns.description: The version of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventReportUrl
columns.description: A URL provided in the event for a resource that provides more information about the event.

columns.name: EventSubType
columns.description: Describes a subdivision of the operation reported in the EventType field.

columns.name: RequestedIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address requested by the DHCP client, when available.

columns.name: SrcDeviceType
columns.description: The type of the device.

columns.name: SrcDomainType
columns.description: The type of the domain.

columns.name: SrcDvcId
columns.description: The ID of the device.

columns.name: SrcDvcIdType
columns.description: The type of the DvcId.

columns.name: SrcDvcScope
columns.description: The cloud platform scope the device belongs to.

columns.name: SrcDvcScopeId
columns.description: The cloud platform scope ID the device belongs to.

columns.name: SrcFQDN
columns.description: The device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device.

columns.name: SrcOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original source user type, if provided by the source.

columns.name: SrcPortNumber
columns.description: The IP port on which the device communicated, if applicable.

columns.name: SrcUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the user.

columns.name: SrcUserIdType
columns.description: The type of SrcUserId.

columns.name: SrcUsername
columns.description: The user's username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcUsernameType
columns.description: The type of username.

columns.name: SrcUserScope
columns.description: The type of username.

columns.name: SrcUserScopeId
columns.description: The scope ID, such as Azure AD tenant ID, in which UserId and Username are defined.

columns.name: SrcUserSessionId
columns.description: The unique ID of the sign-in session of the user.

columns.name: SrcUserType
columns.description: The type of user

columns.name: SrcUserUid
columns.description: The Unix or Linux user ID of the user.

columns.name: SrcGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoRegion
columns.description: The region within a country associated with the source IP address..

columns.name: SrcGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified Source.

columns.name: SrcOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associaeted with the identified Source as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: RuleName
columns.description: The name or ID of the rule by associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: RuleNumber
columns.description: The number of the rule associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: ThreatId
columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the activity.

columns.name: ThreatName
columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the activity.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in activity.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified threat. The level should be a number between 0 and 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatField
columns.description: The field for which a threat was identified.

columns.name: ThreatConfidence
columns.description: The confidence level of the threat identified, normalized to a value between 0 and a 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalConfidence
columns.description: The original confidence level of the threat identified, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatIsActive
columns.description: True ID the threat identified is considered an active threat.

columns.name: ThreatFirstReportedTime
columns.description: The first time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatLastReportedTime
columns.description: The last time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: EventSchema
columns.description: The schema the event is normalized to. Each schema documents its schema name.

columns.name: EventSchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema. Each schema documents its current version.

columns.name: EventStartTime
columns.description: The time in which the event started. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time when the first event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventEndTime
columns.description: The time in which the event ended. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time when the last event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information, represented using key/value pairs provided by the source which do not map to ASim.

tables.name: ASimFileEventLogs
tables.description: The Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM) File Event normalization schema describes file activity such as creating, modifying, or deleting files or documents.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: EventProduct
columns.description: The product generating the event.

columns.name: EventVendor
columns.description: The vendor of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventResult
columns.description: The outcome of the event, represented by one of the following values: Success, Partial, Failure, NA (Not Applicable). The value may not be provided directly by the sources, in which case it is derived from other event fields, for example, the EventResultDetails field.

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: The severity of the event. Valid values are: Informational, Low, Medium, or High.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The operation reported by the record.

columns.name: TargetFilePath
columns.description: The full, normalized path of the target file, including the folder or location, the file name, and the extension.

columns.name: TargetFilePathType
columns.description: The type of TargetFilePath.

columns.name: ActorUsername
columns.description: The Actor username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: EventResultDetails
columns.description: The HTTP status code.

columns.name: DvcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcHostname
columns.description: The hostname of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomainType
columns.description: The type of DvcDomain. Valid values include 'Windows' and 'FQDN'.

columns.name: DvcFQDN
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcId
columns.description: The unique ID of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DvcId.

columns.name: DvcAction
columns.description: The action taken on the web session.

columns.name: TargetFileName
columns.description: The name of the target file, without a path or a location, but with an extension if relevant.

columns.name: HashType
columns.description: The type of hash stored in the Hash alias field.

columns.name: SrcFileName
columns.description: The name of the source file, without a path or a location, but with an extension if relevant.

columns.name: SrcFilePath
columns.description: The full, normalized path of the source file, including the folder or location, the file name, and the extension.

columns.name: SrcFilePathType
columns.description: The type of SrcFilePath.

columns.name: ActorUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the actor.

columns.name: SrcIpAddr
columns.description: When the operation is initiated by a remote system, the IP address of this system.

columns.name: SrcHostname
columns.description: The source device hostname, excluding domain information. If no device name is available, store the relevant IP address in this field.

columns.name: SrcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the source device.

columns.name: SrcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the source device.

columns.name: EventMessage
columns.description: A general message or description.

columns.name: EventCount
columns.description: This value is used when the source supports aggregation, and a single record may represent multiple events.

columns.name: EventSubType
columns.description: Additional description of the event type, if applicable.

columns.name: EventOriginalUid
columns.description: A unique ID of the original record, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalType
columns.description: The original event type or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalSubType
columns.description: The original event subtype or ID, if provided by the source. For example, this field will be used to store the original Windows logon type. This value is used to derive EventSubType, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: EventOriginalResultDetails
columns.description: The original result details provided by the source. This value is used to derive EventResultDetails, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: EventOriginalSeverity
columns.description: The original severity as provided by the reporting device. This value is used to derive EventSeverity.

columns.name: EventProductVersion
columns.description: The version of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventReportUrl
columns.description: A URL provided in the event for a resource that provides more information about the event.

columns.name: EventOwner
columns.description: The owner of the event, which is usually the department or subsidiary in which it was generated.

columns.name: DvcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device.

columns.name: DvcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcZone
columns.description: The network on which the event occurred or which reported the event, depending on the schema.

columns.name: DvcOs
columns.description: The operating system running on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOsVersion
columns.description: The version of the operating system on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOriginalAction
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcInterface
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcScopeId
columns.description: The cloud platform scope ID the device belongs to. DvcScopeId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DvcScope
columns.description: The cloud platform scope the device belongs to. DvcScope map to a subscription name on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the file activity.

columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the file activity.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in the file activity.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified threat. The level should be a number between 0 and 100.

columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.description: A file path for which a threat was identified. The field ThreatField contains the name of the field ThreatFilePath represents.

tables.name: ASimUserManagementActivityLogs
tables.description: The ASim User Management schema represents user management activities, such as creating a user or a group, changing user attribute, or adding a user to a group. Such events are reported, for example, by operating systems, directory services, identity management systems, and any other system reporting on its local user management activity.

columns.name: TargetUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the target user.

columns.name: TargetUserUid
columns.description: The Unix or Linux user ID of the user.

columns.name: TargetUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the TargetUserId field.

columns.name: TargetUserScopeId
columns.description: The scope ID, such as Azure AD tenant ID, in which TargetUserId and TargetUsername are defined.

columns.name: TargetUserScope
columns.description: The scope, such as Azure AD tenant name, in which TargetUserId and TargetUsername are defined.

columns.name: TargetUsername
columns.description: The target username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: TargetUsernameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the username stored in the TargetUsername field.

columns.name: TargetUserType
columns.description: The type of target user.

columns.name: TargetUserSessionId
columns.description: The unique ID of the sign-in session of the user.

columns.name: TargetOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original destination user type, if provided by the source.

columns.name: GroupId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the group, for activities involving a group.

columns.name: GroupIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the GroupId field.

columns.name: GroupName
columns.description: The group name, including domain information when available, for activities involving a group.

columns.name: GroupNameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the group name stored in the GroupName field.

columns.name: GroupType
columns.description: The type of the group, for activities involving a group.

columns.name: GroupOriginalType
columns.description: The original group type, if provided by the source.

columns.name: SrcFQDN
columns.description: The source device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the source device.

columns.name: SrcDvcId
columns.description: The ID of the source device as reported in the record.

columns.name: SrcDvcIdType
columns.description: The type of SrcDvcId.

columns.name: SrcDvcScopeId
columns.description: The cloud platform scope ID the source device belongs to. SrcDvcScopeId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: SrcDvcScope
columns.description: The cloud platform scope the source device belongs to. SrcDvcScope map to a subscription name on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: SrcDeviceType
columns.description: The type of the source device.

columns.name: SrcGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoRegion
columns.description: The region within a country associated with the source IP address..

columns.name: SrcGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified Source.

columns.name: SrcOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associaeted with the identified Source as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ActingAppId
columns.description: The ID of the application used by the actor to perform the activity, including a process, browser, or service.

columns.name: ActingAppName
columns.description: The name of the application used by the actor to perform the activity, including a process, browser, or service.

columns.name: ActingAppType
columns.description: The type of acting application.

columns.name: ActingOriginalAppType
columns.description: The acting application type as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: HttpUserAgent
columns.description: When authentication is performed over HTTP or HTTPS, this field's value is the user_agent HTTP header provided by the acting application when performing the authentication.

columns.name: PreviousPropertyValue
columns.description: The previous value that was stored in the specified property.

columns.name: NewPropertyValue
columns.description: The new value stored in the specified property.

columns.name: RuleName
columns.description: The name or ID of the rule by associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: RuleNumber
columns.description: The number of the rule associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: ThreatId
columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the activity.

columns.name: ThreatName
columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the activity.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in activity.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified threat. The level should be a number between 0 and 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatField
columns.description: The field for which a threat was identified.

columns.name: ThreatConfidence
columns.description: The confidence level of the threat identified, normalized to a value between 0 and a 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalConfidence
columns.description: The original confidence level of the threat identified, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatIsActive
columns.description: True ID the threat identified is considered an active threat.

columns.name: ThreatFirstReportedTime
columns.description: The first time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatLastReportedTime
columns.description: The last time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: EventSchema
columns.description: The name of the schema

columns.name: EventSchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema.

columns.name: EventStartTime
columns.description: The time in which the event started. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time when the first event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventEndTime
columns.description: The time in which the event ended. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time when the last event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information, represented using key/value pairs provided by the source which do not map to ASim.

tables.name: ASimRegistryEventLogs
tables.description: The ASim Registry Event schema represents Windows activity of creating, modifying, or deleting Windows Registry entities. Registry events are specific to Windows systems, but are reported by different systems that monitor Windows, such as EDR (End Point Detection and Response) systems, Sysmon, or Windows itself.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: EventProduct
columns.description: The product generating the event.

columns.name: EventVendor
columns.description: The vendor of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventResult
columns.description: The outcome of the event, represented by one of the following values: Success, Partial, Failure, NA (Not Applicable). The value may not be provided directly by the sources, in which case it is derived from other event fields, for example, the EventResultDetails field.

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: The severity of the event. Valid values are: Informational, Low, Medium, or High.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: Describes the operation reported by the record.

columns.name: RegistryKey
columns.description: The registry key associated with the operation, normalized to standard root key naming conventions.

columns.name: RegistryValue
columns.description: The registry value associated with the operation.

columns.name: RegistryValueType
columns.description: The type of registry value, normalized to standard form.

columns.name: RegistryValueData
columns.description: The data stored in the registry value.

columns.name: RegistryPreviousKey
columns.description: For operations that modify the registry, the original registry key, normalized to standard root key naming.

columns.name: RegistryPreviousValue
columns.description: For operations that modify the registry, the original value type, normalized to the standard form.

columns.name: RegistryPreviousValueType
columns.description: For operations that modify the registry, the original value type.

columns.name: RegistryPreviousValueData
columns.description: The original registry data, for operations that modify the registry.

columns.name: ActorUserId
columns.description: A unique ID of the Actor.

columns.name: ActorUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the ActorUserId field.

columns.name: EventResultDetails
columns.description: Reason or details for the result reported in the EventResult field.

columns.name: DvcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP Address of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcHostname
columns.description: The hostname of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomainType
columns.description: The type of DvcDomain.

columns.name: DvcFQDN
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device.

columns.name: DvcId
columns.description: The unique ID of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DvcId.

columns.name: DvcAction
columns.description: For reporting security systems, the action taken by the system.

columns.name: EventMessage
columns.description: A general message or description.

columns.name: EventCount
columns.description: The number of events described by the record.

columns.name: EventSubType
columns.description: Describes a subdivision of the operation reported in the EventType field.

columns.name: EventOriginalType
columns.description: A unique ID of the original record, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalSubType
columns.description: The original event subtype or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalResultDetails
columns.description: The original result details provided by the source.

columns.name: EventOriginalSeverity
columns.description: The original severity as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: EventProductVersion
columns.description: The version of the product generating the event.

columns.name: EventOwner
columns.description: The owner of the event, which is usually the department or subsidiary in which it was generated.

columns.name: EventReportUrl
columns.description: A URL provided in the event for a resource that provides more information about the event.

columns.name: DvcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcZone
columns.description: The network on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOs
columns.description: The operating system running on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOsVersion
columns.description: The version of the operating system on the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcOriginalAction
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcInterface
columns.description: The network interface on which data was captured.

columns.name: DvcScopeId
columns.description: The cloud platform scope ID the device belongs to. DvcScopeId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DvcScope
columns.description: The cloud platform scope the device belongs to. DvcScope map to a subscription name on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: ActorUserAadId
columns.description: The Azure Active Directory ID of the actor.

columns.name: ActorUserSid
columns.description: The Windows user ID (SIDs) of the actor.

columns.name: ActorScopeId
columns.description: The scope ID, such as Azure AD tenant ID, in which ActorUserId and ActorUsername are defined.

columns.name: ActorScope
columns.description: The scope, such as Azure AD tenant, in which ActorUserId and ActorUsername are defined.

columns.name: ActorUsername
columns.description: The user name of the user who initiated the event.

columns.name: ActorUsernameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the user name stored in the ActorUsername field.

columns.name: ActorUserType
columns.description: The type of the Actor.

columns.name: ActorOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original actor user type, if provided by the source.

columns.name: ActorSessionId
columns.description: The unique ID of the login session of the Actor.

columns.name: ActingProcessName
columns.description: The file name of the acting process image file.

columns.name: ActingProcessId
columns.description: The process ID of the acting process.

columns.name: ActingProcessCommandLine
columns.description: The command line used to run the process.

columns.name: ActingProcessGuid
columns.description: A generated unique identifier of the acting process.

columns.name: ParentProcessName
columns.description: The file name of the parent process image file.

columns.name: ParentProcessId
columns.description: The process ID of the parent process.

columns.name: ParentProcessCommandLine
columns.description: The command line used to run the process.

columns.name: ParentProcessGuid
columns.description: A generated unique identifier of the parent process.

columns.name: RuleName
columns.description: The name or ID of the rule by associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: RuleNumber
columns.description: The number of the rule associated with the inspection results.

columns.name: ThreatId
columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the activity.

columns.name: ThreatName
columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the activity.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in activity.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the identified threat. The level should be a number between 0 and 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatField
columns.description: The field for which a threat was identified.

columns.name: ThreatConfidence
columns.description: The confidence level of the threat identified, normalized to a value between 0 and a 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalConfidence
columns.description: The original confidence level of the threat identified, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: ThreatIsActive
columns.description: True ID the threat identified is considered an active threat.

columns.name: ThreatFirstReportedTime
columns.description: The first time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatLastReportedTime
columns.description: The last time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: EventSchema
columns.description: The name of the schema.

columns.name: EventSchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema.

columns.name: EventStartTime
columns.description: The time in which the event started. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time when the first event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventEndTime
columns.description: The time in which the event ended. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time when the last event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information, represented using key/value pairs provided by the source which do not map to ASim.
